hero.title: The Modern React Modal Library
hero.subtitle: A lightweight, promise-based modal component for React that makes handling modals simple, intuitive, and type-safe.

modal.title: React Snappy Modal
modal.content: This is an example of the React Snappy Modal in action. It provides a promise-based API that makes handling modal results easy and intuitive.

features.title: Features
features.subtitle: React Snappy Modal is designed to make modal management simple and intuitive with a powerful promise-based API.

promiseBased.title: Promise-based API
promiseBased.description: Use async/await with your modals to handle user interactions in a clean, sequential way without callback hell.

lightweight.title: Lightweight
lightweight.description: Zero dependencies and tiny bundle size to keep your application fast and performant.

customizable.title: Customizable
customizable.description: Easily customize the appearance and behavior of your modals with simple configuration options.

typeSafe.title: Type Safe
typeSafe.description: Built with TypeScript to provide excellent type checking and IntelliSense support.

controlledFlow.title: Controlled Flow
controlledFlow.description: Control the flow of your application by waiting for user input before proceeding with the next steps.

react18.title: React 18+ Compatible
react18.description: Built to work perfectly with the latest versions of React, including concurrent rendering.

examples.title: Examples
examples.subtitle: See React Snappy Modal in action with these common modal patterns

alertModal.title: Alert Modal
alertModal.description: Simple alert modals can be used to display information to the user. The modal returns a promise that resolves when the user closes it.

confirmModal.title: Confirmation Modal
confirmModal.description: Confirmation modals let users make decisions. The modal returns the value passed to SnappyModal.close(), making it easy to handle user choices.

formModal.title: Form Modal
formModal.description: Easily create modal forms to collect user input. The form data can be passed as the result of the modal, making it simple to process.

modalComponents.alertContent: This is a simple alert modal that displays information to the user.
modalComponents.confirmContent: Are you sure you want to perform this action? This cannot be undone.

installation.title: Installation
installation.subtitle: Get started with React Snappy Modal in just a few simple steps

step1.title: Install the package
step1.description: Install the react-snappy-modal package using your preferred package manager as shown above.

step2.title: Import the modal component and styles
step2.description: Import the SnappyModal component and CSS styles in your application.

step3.title: Add the SnappyModalProvider
step3.description: Wrap your application with the SnappyModalProvider to ensure modals can be displayed anywhere in your app.

step4.title: Start using modals
step4.description: You're all set! Now you can use SnappyModal.show() anywhere in your application to display modals.

usage.title: Usage
usage.subtitle: Learn how to effectively use React Snappy Modal in your application

basicUsage.title: Basic Usage
basicUsage.description: React Snappy Modal provides a simple, promise-based API for displaying modals. Here's a basic example:

configuringOptions.title: Configuring Modal Options
configuringOptions.description: You can customize the behavior and appearance of your modals with various options:

show.name: SnappyModal.show(component, options?)
show.description: Displays a modal containing the provided React component. Returns a Promise that resolves with the value passed to SnappyModal.close().

close.name: SnappyModal.close(value?)
close.description: Closes the currently open modal and resolves the promise returned by SnappyModal.show() with the provided value.

throw.name: SnappyModal.throw(error?)
throw.description: Closes the modal and rejects the promise with the provided error. Useful for handling cancellation or error states.

isShow.name: SnappyModal.isShow()
isShow.description: Returns a boolean indicating whether a modal is currently displayed.

allowOutsideClick.name: allowOutsideClick
allowOutsideClick.description: When true, clicking outside the modal will close it.

allowScroll.name: allowScroll
allowScroll.description: When true, the page behind the modal can be scrolled.

backdrop.name: backdrop
backdrop.description: Controls the modal backdrop. Set to false to hide backdrop, true for default backdrop, or a string CSS color value for a custom color.

zIndex.name: zIndex
zIndex.description: Z-index for the modal and backdrop.
